div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONORABLE, AND right vertuous Lady, ELIZABETH, Countesse of Holland.
div.p:
I Had, and haue buried a good wife, since which time, God hath not disposed of me in a second mariage; by reason wherof,
I haue not a Child of my body: being single, I conuerted to my selfe, and (I know not how) my braine became in labour, and is deliuered of this (I know not what to call it:) it is not worthy the name of a booke, except your Ladiship will deigne to patronage it, and giue it desert, which fauour if your Ladiship indulge towards me, then my Booke like some meane man, that hath been entertained by some great personage, vnder
the protection of your fauorable approbation, shall walk abroad without shame of it owne vnworthines: and my selfe shall remaine, as alwayes I shall haue cause to doe from your former large fauours:
